text: So the scale of the goals, right, the border between self and world has grown huge The self is gigantic here, the self is very tiny here But that process can break down So here's human glioblastoma cells These are cancer cells that are basically disconnected electrically from the collective And at that point, they're back to their unicellular lifestyle They just can't remember the large scale goal of building a nice, nice brain or anything else And so once you understand that, you can actually control that electrical connection between cells and force a larger cognitive light cone onto the system
content_summary: The speaker discusses the concept of bioelectricity and cellular communication, particularly in the context of cancer cells. They highlight how glioblastoma cells can become electrically disconnected from the collective, reverting to a unicellular lifestyle and losing the ability to contribute to larger biological goals, such as brain development.
